title: What are the best kpop companies for foreigners to audition for? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many K-Pop companies in the industry but they’re often split into larger and smaller ones. Don’t know if you’re aware or not, but there’s the Big 3 which include SM, YG and JYP. These larger companies host and produce the more well-known and successful groups. But this doesn’t necessarily mean that smaller companies are less competent. There are several smaller companies such as : Starship, BigHit, Pledis etc. Starship has Monsta X and Sistar; BigHit has BTS; Pledis has Seventeen and Pristin, and all these are groups that are popular right now. But if you’re directing this to a foreigner, I’ll have to say smaller companies. Now, K-pop is quite strict on the “Korean Beauty Standard” but the larger companies tend to look at looks more compared to smaller companies. By this I mean, they prefer to take in someone who is close to the standards and that tends to lean on someone who has asian facial features. Larger companies have less foreigners, as in not of asian descent. SM has close to no foreigners in their company, same goes to JYP and YG only has a couple of artists in the American Branch. Smaller companies may give foreigners a chance if they really exceed their expectation as they’re desperate to put a group in their market so they won’t get broke and earn some profit and garner some attention for future trainees and groups. That being said, being a trainee, hell even getting past round 2 is extremely hard. It’ll take a toll on you mentally and physically, and be sure to expect dangerous diets where you’ll almost black out from exhaustion or plastic surgery. It’s already hard for asians to get into companies, so I’m pretty sure foreigners will have a much harder time getting in. It’s the cold and harsh truth, and even though it is extremely unfair, the companies have to consider the fan’s reaction, whether it’ll be acceptable to have a such a huge change in the K-pop industry. If being a K-pop trainee is your ultimate dream and you have so much passion, you should step back and consider the pros and cons and look at the different aspects of the industry as it is truly notorious for the rigorous and dangerous training so brace yourself. Nonetheless, give a shot at as many companies as you can so you can maximize your chances of getting into a group.
